node.Title: Monitor your own network with free network flow analytics from Cloudflare
node.Description: Cloudflare is excited to announce that we are releasing a free version of Magic Networking Monitoring (previously called Flow Based Monitoring). Magic Network Monitoring receives network flow data from a customer’s router(s) and provides network traffic analytics via Cloudflare’s dashboard.

node.Title: For developers, flow state starts with your finger tips
node.Description:
Sponsored by Logitech Developers and their employers are constantly thinking about productivity. We partnered with Logitech to produce a four-part podcast series to chat about how your hardware and software work together to keep you in a flow state and make you more productive. Each podcast will have it’s own landing page on the blog,…

The post For developers, flow state starts with your finger tips  appeared first on Stack Overflow Blog.

node.Description:
A primer on how to reconcile the seemingly similar but different trends that confuse data teams struggling with solving the intractable “everything everywhere all at once” problem.

node.Title: Don’t let software steal your time (Ep. 491)
node.Description:
While countless apps are competing for your attention, here's some tips on how to fight back.

node.Title: Set up the customer portal without code
node.Description: You can now set up a prebuilt customer portal in minutes–without a line of code–empowering your customers to manage their subscriptions, invoices, and payment details themselves.

node.Title: Research is key to a strong cybersecurity program
Snyk & 01Founders partner to diversify tech
node.Description: On September 15, Snyk kick off our partnership with 01Founders by hosting 30 learners at our London office. The event featured a panel discussion, capture the flag challenge, and networking opportunities with dozens of Snykers. Read on for a recap of the day!

node.Title: AWS IoT FleetWise Now Generally Available – Easily Collect Vehicle Data and Send to the Cloud
node.Description: Today we announce the general availability of AWS IoT FleetWise, a fully managed AWS service that makes it easier to collect, transform, and transfer vehicle data to the cloud. Last AWS re:Invent 2021, we previewed AWS IoT FleetWise, heard customer feedback, and improved features for various use cases of near-real-time vehicle data processing. With AWS […]

node.Title: Terraform Enterprise Adds Run Metrics, Versioned Docs, and More
node.Description: Terraform Enterprise enhances observability and cuts operational burden with improved run metrics, identity-based storage authentication, and versioned documentation.

node.Title: Stack Overflow trends: Weekday vs weekend site activity
node.Description:

node.Title: Cloudflare named a Leader in WAF by Forrester
node.Description: Forester has recognised Cloudflare as a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Web Application Firewalls, Q3 2022 report. The report evaluated 12 Web Application Firewall (WAF) providers on 24 criteria across current offering, strategy and market presence.

node.Title: How to Make a Digital Bullet Journal: A Comprehensive Guide
node.Description:
Journals have been a global mainstay for generations, and for a good reason. They allow you to write down your ideas, brainstorm your thoughts, and express your feelings so you can understand them more clearly. Jotting down your thoughts, writing a schedule, or creating sketches can all be done with a digital bullet journal. Here you’ll learn how to create and maintain a digital bullet journal of your own, and

Continue reading...

The post How to Make a Digital Bullet Journal: A Comprehensive Guide appeared first on .

node.Title: Build your next startup on Cloudflare with our comprehensive Startup Plan, v2.0
node.Description: The Startup Plan now has an expanded product basket and broader eligibility criteria, which means more startups now qualify for the program.

node.Title: The world’s leading venture capitalist firms commit $1.25 BILLION to back startups built on Cloudflare Workers
node.Description: Building and scaling a startup is hard work. Apply to the $1.5BN the Workers Launchpad funding program for an opportunity to pitch leading VCs and other perks

node.Title: D1: our quest to simplify databases
node.Description: Get an inside look on the D1 experience today, what the team is currently working on and what’s coming up!

node.Title: Introducing Cache Rules: precision caching at your fingertips
node.Description: We have spent the last ten years learning how customers use Page Rules to customize their cached content, and it’s clear the time is ripe for evolving rules-based caching on Cloudflare

node.Title: WebRTC live streaming to unlimited viewers, with sub-second latency
node.Description: Cloudflare Stream now supports live streaming over WebRTC to unlimited concurrent viewers, using open standards WHIP and WHEP, with zero dependencies or client SDKs necessary.

node.Title: Introducing workerd: the Open Source Workers runtime
node.Description: workerd is the JavaScript/Wasm runtime code that powers Cloudflare Workers, now open source under the Apache 2.0 license

node.Title: Build real-time video and audio apps on the world’s most interconnected network
node.Description: We are announcing Cloudflare Calls, a new product that lets developers build real-time audio and video apps

node.Title: Dynamic URL redirects: 301 to the future
node.Description: With Dynamic redirects, users can redirect visitors to another webpage or website based upon hundreds of options such as the visitor's country of origin or language, without having to write a single line of code

node.Title: Where to? Introducing Origin Rules
node.Description: Origin Rules is a dedicated product for ‘where does this traffic go where it leaves Cloudflare.’ Customers are able to match on an HTTP request using filters and override the host, port, SNI, and the origin a request resolves to.

node.Title: Introducing Configuration Rules
node.Description: Configuration Rules is the new and improved way for Cloudflare customers to control and manipulate features that are enabled or disabled for specific requests on their zone.

node.Title: The future of Page Rules
node.Description: Learn about four new products that will eventually replace Page Rules by putting more power into the hands of users.

node.Title: Cloudflare Queues: globally distributed queues without the egress fees
node.Description: Cloudflare Queues is a message queuing service that allows applications to reliably send and receive messages using Cloudflare Workers

node.Title: Optimize your .NET application performance with the Datadog Continuous Profiler
node.Description: .NET is a framework built by Microsoft that simplifies the complexities of developing cross-platform applications. Using .NET, developers can create powerful applications with rapid response times and more. We’re excited to announce that the Datadog Continuous Profiler now provides general support for .NET applications, including .NET Framework, .NET Core, and .NET 5+. Using Continuous Profiler, you can compare the code performance of your .NET application across different versions, time frames, and environments directly in production, enabling you to identify resource bottlenecks and improve user experience.
